cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest, forecast to turn north-northwest and track up the Florida peninsula, then inland across southwest Georgia toward the southeastern United States interior.

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from north of Fernandina Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Storm Surge Warning from South Santee River, SC southward to Jupiter Inlet, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from South Carolina southward through the Florida Keys
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (generally < 39–57 mph) possible late Monday into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above ground possible along the South Carolina coast including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 10 inches, producing flash-flood potential in the Charleston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
